articles.title: Leaving 'Star Wars' Is the Smartest Thing the 'Game of Thrones' Showrunneers Ever Did
articles.description: Let's be honest, this is better for everyone.

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: How to Keep Your Siri, Alexa, and Google Assistant Voice Recordings Private
articles.description: Alexa, Siri, and Google Assistant now all give you ways to opt out of human transcription of your voice snippets. Do it.
articles.content: After months of revelations and apologies, all the major smart assistant makers have revamped how they handle human review of audio snippets. Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple Siri, and Microsoft Cortana were all using third-party contractors to transcrib… [+3538 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: The Glorious Victories of Trans Athletes Are Shaking Up Sports
articles.description: Some critics claim transgender athletes are ruining competition for cis women and girls, but they forget: Sports—and life—have never been fair.
articles.content: Transgender athletes are having a moment. At all levels of sport, theyre stepping onto the podium and into the headlines. New Zealand weightlifter Laurel Hubbard won two gold medals at the Pacific Games, and college senior CeCé Telfer became the NCAA Division… [+3468 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: 12 Best Gaming Headsets for PS4, Xbox, PC, and Switch
articles.description: No matter which console or device you play on, these headsets will serve you well.
articles.content: A good headset can make all the difference when you're teaming up online. You need to be able to hear your environment and your allies with clarity, without one being drowned out by the other. Nobody likes sweaty ears, either. Luckily, there are quite a few h… [+522 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: HBO's 'His Dark Materials' Is a Smart Pragmatic Adaptation
articles.description: The show promises to engage with the ambiguities of truth and knowledge, and (please!) maybe even give some backstory on the charming, enigmatic Mrs. Coulter.
articles.content: If you had a daemon, what would it be? If your soul existed in animal formas a butterfly or an osprey or lynxand if you could talk to that creature and if that creature could serve as a conscience, a confidant, an extension to your perception, or maybe even a… [+3961 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg Needs to Shut Up
articles.description: Opinion: Since 2017, nearly every time Mark Zuckerberg has tried to sound thoughtful, he sounds unprepared, shallow, and full of hubris. Time to zip it.
articles.content: Mark Zuckerberg never calls me for advice. But he should. I would tell him to fire his entire communications and lobbying staff. They are incompetent. They have only made matters worse for the company. Did no one think to brief Zuckerberg on the two or three … [+4030 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: Google's .New Shortcuts Are Now for Everyone
articles.description: Want to start a playlist, make a dinner reservation, or post code to Github? Try Google's latest URL hack.
articles.content: A year ago, Google introduced one of those time-saving tricks that makes the cold, relentless march of time just a little bit more bearable: You could suddenly create a new Google doc simply by typing doc.new into your URL bar. Ditto spreadsheets, calendar ev… [+3991 chars]

articles.title: The Shady Cryptocurrency Boom on the Post-Soviet Frontier
articles.description: Dodgy energy deals, loose regulation, and dubious characters—with links to the Hillary Clinton email hackers—are fueling a burgeoning crypto industry that could provide an end run around US sanctions.

articles.title: Bees, Please: Stop Dying in Your Martian Simulator
articles.description: Future space colonists will need pollinators to grow food on the moon and Mars. But first scientists need to figure out how to keep them alive.
articles.content: Before astronauts head to the International Space Station, they spend years getting ready: They float in pools to practice for spacewalks, learn how to run different types of science experiments, and even practice how to poop. For future missions to the moon … [+2621 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: Uber Eats Hopes Drones Can Lift It to Profitability
articles.description: Uber reveals the design of a drone with six rotors that change position for vertical takeoffs and landings. It can stay aloft for 18 minutes, with a range of 18 miles.
articles.content: Come next summer, the most remarkable thing about your home-delivered late-night California burrito wont be the French fries inside. Itll be that the San Diego speciality made part of its journey by drone, as part of a scheme to pull Ubers food-delivery busin… [+3303 chars]
